text.1: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa jika matahari telah digulung, telah padam cahayanya dan jatuh berantakan bersamaan dengan hancurnya alam semesta yang pernah didiami oleh makhluk-makhluk yang hidup di dunia, maka musnahlah segala alam karena berpindah kepada alam yang lain.
text.2: Apabila bintang-bintang berjatuhan dan padam sekalian cahayanya.
text.3:
Dan apabila gunung-gunung dihancurkan setelah dicabut dari bumi, diterbangkan di angkasa ketika terjadinya gempa yang amat dahsyat sehingga gunung-gunung itu terlepas dari dasarnya dan dilemparkan di angkasa seperti awan yang ditiup angin laksana kapas.

Untuk telaah ilmiah Surah at-Takwir/81: 1-3 ini, lihat pula telaah ilmiah Surah al-haqqah/69: 13-16 dan Surah al-Ma'arij/70: 8. Ketika terjadi proses ke arah Big Crunch itu, yaitu proses pemadatan atau penyusutan alam semesta, maka semua materi pecah kembali menjadi materi-materi fundamental seperti quark, elektron dan sebagainya. Gaya-gaya seperti gaya gravitasi, elektromagnetik, nuklir kuat dan nuklir lemah mulai menyatu kembali. Saat itulah benda-benda langit mulai kehilangan gaya-gaya gravitasinya, dan akibatnya terjadilah tabrakan-tabrakan dahsyat antar bintang, inilah gambaran 'bintang-bintang berjatuhan, karena kehilangan gaya-gaya gravitasinya. 

Matahari yang juga merupakan jenis bintang mengalami hal sama. Ketika benda-benda langit saling mendekat, kekuatan gravitasi bagian luar boleh jadi akan melebihi cengkeraman kekuatan plasma di dalam bintang-bintang itu (termasuk matahari). Akibatnya adalah volume matahari dan bintang-bintang yang lain akan memuai. Matahari akan menjadi lebih besar volumenya, namun tekanan internalnya berkurang, dan cukup untuk menghentikan energi yang menghasilkan reaksi perpaduan nuklirnya. Akibatnya sinar matahari (yang memuai itu) akan meredup menjadi merah. Ketika pengembangan volume matahari telah mencapai maksimum, maka matahari akan mengalami kontraksi dan volumenya akan menurun dan menurun terus, mengecil yang akhirnya menjadi bintik hitam yang super-padat (dwarf black hole atau bintik hitam kerdil). Inikah yang dimaksud dengan matahari digulung pada ayat 1 di atas? 

Benturan juga terjadi antar-planet, sehingga bumi berbenturan dengan planet-planet lainnya. Akibat peristiwa inilah terjadinya kehancuran gunung-gunung. Semua proses ini akan mengarah ke Big Crunch dan kembali menjadi singularity.
text.4: Dan apabila unta-unta bunting yang termasuk benda paling dihargai oleh orang-orang Arab, ditinggalkan dan tidak dipedulikan oleh pemiliknya karena kedahsyatan hari Kiamat tersebut. Hal ini menggambarkan kedahsyatan hari Kiamat yang jika diperkirakan, jika ada seorang laki-laki mempunyai unta yang bunting tentu ditinggalkan karena terlalu sibuk memikirkan keselamatan dirinya sendiri.
text.5: Dan apabila binatang-binatang liar dikumpulkan dan dimusnahkan.
text.6:
Dan apabila lautan-lautan dijadikan meluap, sehingga menjadi satu, kemudian menyala dengan kobaran api yang tadinya terpendam di bawah bumi tersebut.

Setelah Allah menerangkan beberapa peristiwa yang menjadi permulaan hancurnya alam semesta dan matinya semua makhluk yang berada di atasnya, maka Allah menjelaskan apa yang terjadi setelah itu tentang kebangkitan.
text.7:
Dan apabila roh-roh dipertemukan kembali dengan tubuh untuk memasuki kehidupan di alam akhirat. Ayat ini mengandung isyarat bahwa roh-roh itu tetap utuh setelah mati dan pada hari Kiamat dikembalikan lagi pada badannya.

Pendapat lain menyebutkan arti ayat ini dengan bertemunya kelompok orang-orang termasuk ashabul-yamin dengan kelompok ashabusy-syimal. Ibnu 'Abbas mengatakan bahwa arti ayat ini adalah dipertemukannya roh orang-orang yang beriman dengan pasangan-pasangannya di surga dan roh orang-orang kafir dipertemukan dengan setan-setan pembantunya.
text.8:
Dan apabila bayi-bayi perempuan yang dikubur hidup-hidup ditanya, karena dosa apakah dia dibunuh? Dalam ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa bayi-bayi yang pernah dikubur hidup-hidup akan dihidupkan kembali di hadapan orang yang menguburkannya dan ditanya karena dosa apakah dia dibunuh. Jawaban pertanyaan ini memberikan kesan yang lebih dalam kepada si pembunuhnya karena bayi perempuan itu akan menjawab bahwa ia dikubur hidup-hidup tanpa dosa sama sekali, hanya karena orang tuanya takut dihinggapi kefakiran dan kemiskinan. Kebiasaan orang Arab pada zaman Jahiliah ini sangat di luar peri kemanusiaan.

Di kalangan mereka ada yang tidak mengubur hidup-hidup anaknya yang perempuan, tetapi ia memberikan pekerjaan kepadanya dengan menggembalakan kambing di padang pasir dengan pakaian bulu dan membiarkan hidup dalam kesepian.

Dan ada pula yang membiarkan anak perempuannya itu hidup sampai umur enam tahun kemudian ia berkata kepada ibunya, "Dandanilah anak ini dengan pakaian yang baik, karena akan dibawa ziarah mengunjungi bibinya." Sebelumnya ia telah menggali sebuah sumur di padang pasir. Setelah ia sampai dengan anak perempuannya itu di tepi sumur itu, lalu berkata, "Tengok, apa yang ada dalam sumur itu." Kemudian anak perempuan itu ditendang dari belakang dan setelah jatuh ke dalam sumur itu lalu ditimbun dan diratakan dengan tanah. Dan di antara mereka ada yang berbuat lebih kejam lagi daripada ini. Setelah datang agama Islam, maka kekejaman yang di luar peri kemanusiaan itu diganti dengan sikap yang penuh ramah dan kesayangan.

Di antara alasan pembunuhan anak perempuan di masa Jahiliah adalah karena anak perempuan dianggap tidak punya nilai ekonomis yang bisa menguntungkan keluarga. Alasan lain adalah karena anak perempuan dianggap sangat lemah, sering menjadi korban pelecehan seksual atau karena perempuan dianggap sebagai penggoda laki-laki yang bisa membuat malu keluarga.

Dalam Surah an-Nahl/16: 58, Allah menggambarkan seorang laki-laki yang mendapat kelahiran putrinya dengan wajah hitam karena menahan marah.

Padahal apabila seseorang dari mereka diberi kabar dengan (kelahiran) anak perempuan, wajahnya menjadi hitam (merah padam), dan dia sangat marah. (an-Nahl/16: 58)

Islam adalah agama yang menghormati perempuan, sama seperti menghormati laki-laki. Oleh sebab itu, Islam melarang pembunuhan bayi laki-laki maupun perempuan, baik karena kemiskinan atau karena takut miskin. Allah berfirman:

Janganlah membunuh anak-anakmu karena miskin. Kamilah yang memberi rezeki kepadamu dan kepada mereka. (al-An'am/6: 151)

text.10:
Dalam ayat ini dijelaskan apabila catatan-catatan amal perbuatan manusia dibuka, maka mereka akan melihat kebajikan atau kejahatan yang mereka perbuat ketika di dunia. Mereka akan tercengang keheranan karena tidak menyangka semuanya tercatat rapi dan teliti. Allah berfirman:

Dan diletakkanlah kitab (catatan amal), lalu engkau akan melihat orang yang berdosa merasa ketakutan terhadap apa yang (tertulis) di dalamnya, dan mereka berkata, "Betapa celaka kami, kitab apakah ini, tidak ada yang tertinggal, yang kecil dan yang besar melainkan tercatat semuanya," dan mereka dapati (semua) apa yang telah mereka kerjakan (tertulis). Dan Tuhanmu tidak menzalimi seorang jua pun. (al-Kahf/18: 49)

Bagaimana bentuk kitab atau catatan amal perbuatan manusia itu di Padang Mahsyar tidak kita ketahui. Namun kalau manusia saja mampu menciptakan berbagai alat perekam yang begitu canggih dan teliti, kita percaya bahwa Allah Sang Pencipta manusia punya sistem dan cara untuk merekam perbuatan, perkataan, dan isi hati manusia dengan hasil yang lebih baik dari apa yang dapat dibuat manusia.
text.11:
Dan apabila langit dilenyapkan karena kehancuran planet-planet yang ada di dalamnya. Langit yang begitu luas dapat dilipat seperti melipat kertas. Firman Allah:

(Ingatlah) pada hari langit Kami gulung seperti menggulung lembaran-lembaran kertas. (al-Anbiya'/21: 104)
text.12:
Dan apabila neraka Jahim yang disediakan untuk menyiksa orang-orang kafir dan durhaka telah dinyalakan sehebat-hebatnya sehingga orang yang memasukinya merasa kesakitan yang paling dahsyat. Itulah azab yang diancamkan Allah kepada orang-orang yang mengingkari-Nya. Firman Allah:

Sungguh, Kami telah menyediakan bagi orang-orang kafir rantai, belenggu dan neraka yang menyala-nyala. (al-Insan/76: 4)
text.13:
Dan apabila surga didekatkan kepada orang-orang yang akan memasukinya yaitu orang-orang mukmin yang bertakwa. Ini adalah balasan atas jerih payah dan usaha mereka berjihad menegakkan agama Allah dan menjalankan perintah agama. Allah berfirman:

Dan surga didekatkan kepada orang-orang yang bertakwa. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 90)
text.14:
Jika semua peristiwa-peristiwa yang disebutkan sebelum ayat ini telah terjadi, tiap jiwa akan mengetahui apa yang telah dikerjakannya. Sebagian besar dari manusia ketika hidup di dunia tertipu oleh godaan setan. Mereka akan menjumpai amal perbuatan mereka pada hari Kiamat tidak diterima oleh Allah bahkan dijauhkan dari rahmat-Nya dan berada di bawah murka-Nya.

Orang-orang yang amal perbuatannya diselubungi dengan ria, tidak mendapat faedah dari amalnya itu kecuali sekadar kepayahan dan kesulitan. Setiap orang wajib memandang kepada amal perbuatannya dengan kaca mata agama dan menimbangnya dengan timbangan yang benar, sebab Allah tidak menerima amal perbuatan melainkan yang muncul dari hati yang penuh dengan keimanan dan keikhlasan.
text.15: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah bersumpah demi bintang-bintang yang beredar dan terbenam. Bintang-bintang itu semuanya tidak tampak oleh penglihatan pada siang hari, namun akan kelihatan bersinar pada malam hari. Allah bersumpah dengan bintang-bintang itu karena dalam keadaannya yang silih berganti, tidak tampak ketika siang dan bersinar pada malam hari, merupakan tanda atas kekuasaan Allah yang mengatur perjalanannya.
text.16: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah bersumpah demi bintang-bintang yang beredar dan terbenam. Bintang-bintang itu semuanya tidak tampak oleh penglihatan pada siang hari, namun akan kelihatan bersinar pada malam hari. Allah bersumpah dengan bintang-bintang itu karena dalam keadaannya yang silih berganti, tidak tampak ketika siang dan bersinar pada malam hari, merupakan tanda atas kekuasaan Allah yang mengatur perjalanannya.
text.17: Dalam ayat ini, Allah bersumpah demi malam apabila telah hampir meninggalkan gelapnya.
text.18:
Kemudian dalam ayat ini Allah bersumpah demi subuh apabila fajar mulai menyingsing dan bersinar. Waktu subuh digunakan Allah dalam bersumpah karena waktu ini menimbulkan harapan yang menggembirakan bagi setiap manusia yang bangun pagi karena menghadapi hari yang baru. Saat itu mereka dapat menemukan hajat keperluan hidupnya mengganti yang hilang dan bersiap-siap untuk yang akan datang.

Kemudian Allah menerangkan apa yang dijadikan objek sumpahnya itu, dengan firman-Nya pada ayat berikut ini.
text.19:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan objek sumpah yang disebutkan dalam ayat 15-18 di atas, yaitu sesungguhnya apa yang diberitahukan oleh Muhammad saw tentang peristiwa-peristiwa hari Kiamat bukanlah kata-kata seorang dukun atau isapan jempol. Akan tetapi, benar-benar wahyu yang dibawa oleh Malaikat Jibril dari Tuhannya. Allah telah menyifati utusan yang membawa Al-Qur'an tersebut, yaitu Malaikat Jibril, dengan lima macam sifat yang mengandung keutamaan:

1.Yang mulia pada sisi Tuhannya karena Allah memberikan padanya sesuatu yang paling berharga yaitu hidayah, dan memerintahkannya untuk menyampaikan hidayah itu kepada para nabi-Nya diteruskan kepada para hamba-Nya.

2.Yang mempunyai kekuatan dalam memelihara Al-Qur'an jauh dari sifat pelupa atau keliru.

3.Yang mempunyai kedudukan tinggi di sisi Allah yang mempunyai 'Arasy.

4.Yang ditaati di kalangan malaikat karena kewenangannya.

5.Yang dipercaya untuk menyampaikan wahyu karena terpelihara dari sifat-sifat khianat dan penyelewengan.

text.22:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menyifati Nabi Muhammad dengan mengatakan bahwa Muhammad itu bukanlah orang gila, sebagaimana yang dituduhkan oleh orang-orang kafir Mekah.

Kalimat "temanmu" dalam ayat ini merupakan alasan untuk menerangkan kedustaan mereka. Sebab, setiap orang akan mengenal tabiat temannya yang sehari-hari bergaul dengannya. Orang-orang Quraisy itu selalu bergaul dengan Nabi Muhammad semenjak beliau masih kecil dan mengetahui kejujuran beliau. Oleh karena itu, mereka memberikan julukan kehormatan kepadanya dengan kata-kata "al-Amin" sebelum beliau menjadi nabi.

Beliau tidak pernah berdusta, menyalahi janji, atau berkhianat, sehingga apa-apa yang dituduhkan kepada Nabi Muhammad itu tentang sifat gila, tukang sihir, atau pendusta adalah bohong semata.
text.23:
Nabi Muhammad pernah melihat Jibril dalam bentuk yang asli dua kali dalam hidupnya. Pertama, ketika beliau berada di Gua Hira sebelum turunnya Surah al-Muddatstsir, dan kedua, ketika beliau mi'raj ke langit ketujuh. Firman Allah 

Dan sungguh, dia (Muhammad) telah melihatnya (dalam rupanya yang asli) pada waktu yang lain, (yaitu) di Sidratul Muntaha. (an-Najm/53: 13-14)
text.24: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Nabi Muhammad bukanlah seorang bakhil dalam menyampaikan seluruh wahyu yang disampaikan malaikat Jibril kepadanya. Di samping itu, beliau adalah seorang yang sangat dipercaya karena tidak pernah mengubah wahyu walaupun satu huruf dengan ucapannya sendiri.
text.25: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Al-Qur'an bukanlah perkataan setan yang terkutuk, dan bukanlah perkataan yang diletakkan oleh setan di atas lidah Muhammad ketika mengganggu akalnya seperti yang dituduhkan oleh orang Quraisy. Muhammad sudah terkenal sejak kecilnya dengan pikiran yang sehat dan tidak pernah berbuat khianat. Oleh karena itu, apa yang diterangkan oleh Muhammad tentang berita akhirat, surga, dan neraka bukanlah perkataan setan.
text.26: Kemudian Allah menerangkan bahwa orang-orang Quraisy itu telah sesat, jauh dari jalan kebenaran, dan tidak mengetahui jalan kebijaksanaan, sehingga Allah bertanya kepada mereka, "Maka ke manakah kamu akan pergi?" Maksudnya ialah sesudah diterangkan bahwa Al-Qur'an itu benar-benar datang dari Allah dan di dalamnya terdapat pelajaran dan petunjuk yang membimbing manusia ke jalan yang lurus, ditanyakan kepada orang-orang kafir itu, "Jalan manakah yang akan kamu tempuh lagi?"
text.27: Kemudian Allah menyatakan bahwa Al-Qur'an itu tiada lain hanya peringatan bagi semesta alam, bagi mereka yang mempunyai hati cenderung kepada kebaikan. Namun demikian, tidak semua manusia dapat mengambil manfaat dari Al-Qur'an ini. Yang mengambil manfaat ialah siapa yang mau menempuh jalan yang lurus. Adapun orang yang menyimpang dari jalan itu, maka ia tidak dapat mengambil manfaat dari peringatan Al-Qur'an.
text.28: Kemudian Allah menyatakan bahwa Al-Qur'an itu tiada lain hanya peringatan bagi semesta alam, bagi mereka yang mempunyai hati cenderung kepada kebaikan. Namun demikian, tidak semua manusia dapat mengambil manfaat dari Al-Qur'an ini. Yang mengambil manfaat ialah siapa yang mau menempuh jalan yang lurus. Adapun orang yang menyimpang dari jalan itu, maka ia tidak dapat mengambil manfaat dari peringatan Al-Qur'an.
text.29: Dalam ayat ini, Allah mengatakan bahwa manusia tidak mempunyai kehendak sendiri untuk berbuat sesuatu yang dikehendakinya bilamana tidak sesuai dengan kehendak Allah.

en.name: The Folding Up
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: In this verse, Allah explains that when the sun has been rolled up, its light extinguished, and it falls apart along with the destruction of the universe that was once inhabited by creatures living in the world, then all of existence will perish because it will transition to another realm.
text.2: When the stars fall and their light is extinguished altogether.
text.3:
And when the mountains are crushed after being uprooted from the earth, flown in the sky when a terrible earthquake occurs so that the mountains are detached from their bases and thrown into the sky like clouds blown by the wind like cotton.

For a scientific study of Surah at-Takwir/81: 1-3, see also the scientific study of Surah al-Haqqah/69: 13-16 and Surah al-Ma'arij/70: 8. When the process towards the Big Crunch occurs, namely the process of compaction or shrinkage of the universe, then all matter breaks back down into fundamental materials such as quarks, electrons, and so on. Forces such as gravity, electromagnetism, strong nuclear force, and weak nuclear force begin to merge again. At that time, celestial bodies begin to lose their gravitational forces, and as a result, there are massive collisions between stars, this is the picture of 'stars falling, because they lose their gravitational forces.

The sun, which is also a type of star, experiences the same thing. When celestial bodies get closer to each other, the gravitational force of the outer part may exceed the grip of the plasma force inside the stars (including the sun). The result is that the volume of the sun and other stars will expand. The sun will become larger in volume, but its internal pressure will decrease, and it will be enough to stop the energy that produces its nuclear fusion reaction. As a result, sunlight (which is expanding) will dim to red. When the expansion of the sun's volume has reached its maximum, the sun will contract and its volume will continue to decrease, shrinking until it becomes a super-dense black spot (dwarf black hole). Is this what is meant by the sun being rolled up in verse 1 above?

Collisions also occur between planets, so the earth collides with other planets. It is as a result of this event that the destruction of the mountains occurs. All of this process will lead to the Big Crunch and return to singularity.
text.4: And when the pregnant she-camels, which are among the most prized possessions of the Arabs, are abandoned and neglected by their owners due to the terror of the Day of Judgment. This illustrates the severity of the Day of Judgment, that if it were to be imagined, if a man possessed a pregnant she-camel, he would surely abandon it because he would be too preoccupied with thinking about his own safety.
text.5: And when the wild beasts are gathered and destroyed.
text.6:
And when the oceans are caused to overflow, becoming one, then ignite with flames that were previously hidden beneath the earth.

After Allah explained several events that mark the beginning of the destruction of the universe and the death of all creatures upon it, then Allah explains what happens after that regarding the resurrection.
text.7:
And when souls are rejoined with bodies to enter life in the afterlife. This verse contains an indication that souls remain intact after death and on the Day of Judgment are returned to their bodies.

Another opinion mentions that the meaning of this verse is the meeting of groups of people, including *ashabul-yamin* with the group of *ashabusy-syimal*. Ibn 'Abbas said that the meaning of this verse is the meeting of the souls of believers with their spouses in Paradise and the souls of disbelievers are reunited with their helper devils.
text.8:
And when the female infants buried alive are asked, for what sin were they killed? In this verse, Allah explains that the female infants who were buried alive will be resurrected in front of those who buried them and asked for what sin they were killed. The answer to this question gives a deeper impression to the killer because the female infant will answer that she was buried alive without any sin at all, only because her parents were afraid of poverty and destitution. This custom of the Arabs in the Jahiliyyah era was very inhumane.

Among them, some did not bury their daughters alive, but gave them work by herding goats in the desert with wool clothing and letting them live in solitude.

And some let their daughters live until the age of six, then he would say to his mother, "Dress this child in good clothes, because she will be taken on a pilgrimage to visit her aunt." Previously, he had dug a well in the desert. After he arrived with his daughter at the edge of the well, he said, "Look, what is in the well." Then the daughter was kicked from behind and after falling into the well, it was covered and leveled with the ground. And among them, some committed even more cruel acts than this. After Islam came, this inhumane cruelty was replaced with an attitude full of friendliness and affection.

Among the reasons for killing daughters in the Jahiliyyah era was because daughters were considered to have no economic value that could benefit the family. Another reason was because daughters were considered very weak, often victims of sexual harassment, or because women were considered seducers of men who could bring shame to the family.

In Surah an-Nahl/16: 58, Allah describes a man who receives the news of the birth of his daughter with a black face because he is holding back anger.

And when one of them is given good tidings of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes darkened, and he suppresses [his rage]. (an-Nahl/16: 58)

Islam is a religion that respects women, just as it respects men. Therefore, Islam forbids the killing of male or female infants, whether because of poverty or fear of poverty. Allah says:

And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. (al-An'am/6: 151)
text.9:
And when the female infants who were buried alive are asked, for what sin were they killed? In this verse, Allah explains that the infants who were once buried alive will be resurrected in front of those who buried them and asked for what sin they were killed. The answer to this question gives a deeper impression to the killer because the female infant will answer that she was buried alive without any sin at all, only because her parents were afraid of being afflicted by poverty and destitution. This custom of the Arabs in the Jahiliyyah era was very inhumane.

Among them, there were those who did not bury their daughters alive, but instead gave them work by herding goats in the desert with woolen clothes and leaving them to live in solitude.

And there were also those who let their daughters live until the age of six, then he would say to his mother, "Dress this child in good clothes, because she will be taken on a pilgrimage to visit her aunt." Previously, he had dug a well in the desert. After he arrived with his daughter at the edge of the well, he said, "Look, what is in the well." Then the daughter was kicked from behind, and after falling into the well, it was buried and leveled with the ground. And among them, there were those who acted even more cruelly than this. After Islam came, this inhumane cruelty was replaced with an attitude full of friendliness and affection.

Among the reasons for killing female children in the Jahiliyyah era was because female children were considered to have no economic value that could benefit the family. Another reason was because female children were considered very weak, often victims of sexual abuse, or because women were considered as seducers of men who could bring shame to the family.

In Surah an-Nahl/16: 58, Allah describes a man who receives the news of the birth of his daughter with a black face because he is holding back anger.

And when one of them is given good tidings of (the birth of) a female, his face becomes darkened, and he suppresses (his rage). (an-Nahl/16: 58)

Islam is a religion that respects women, just as it respects men. Therefore, Islam prohibits the killing of male or female infants, whether because of poverty or fear of poverty. Allah says:

And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. (al-An'am/6: 151)
text.10:
This verse explains that when the records of human deeds are opened, they will see the good or evil they committed in the world. They will be astonished and amazed because they did not expect everything to be recorded neatly and meticulously. Allah says:

"And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this record that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one." (al-Kahf/18: 49)

We do not know what form the book or record of human deeds will take on the Plain of Gathering (Padang Mahsyar). However, if humans are capable of creating various recording devices that are so sophisticated and meticulous, we believe that Allah, the Creator of mankind, has a system and a way to record human actions, words, and thoughts with results that are better than what humans can create.
text.11:
And when the sky is obliterated due to the destruction of the planets within it. The sky, which is so vast, can be folded like folding paper. Allah says:

(Remember) the Day We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet. (al-Anbiya'/21: 104)
text.12:
And when Hellfire Jahim, which has been prepared to punish the disbelievers and the disobedient, is kindled to its utmost intensity, so that those who enter it feel the most terrible pain. That is the punishment that Allah has threatened those who deny Him with. Allah says:

Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blazing Fire. (al-Insan/76: 4)
text.13:
And when Paradise is brought near to those who will enter it, namely the believing and pious people. This is a reward for their hard work and efforts in striving to uphold the religion of Allah and carry out religious commands. Allah says:

And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous. (ash-Shu'ara'/26: 90)
text.14:
If all the events mentioned before this verse have occurred, every soul will know what it has done. Most people, when they lived in the world, were deceived by the temptations of Satan. They will find that their deeds on the Day of Judgment are not accepted by Allah, even distanced from His mercy and under His wrath.

Those whose deeds are veiled with *riya* (ostentation) will not benefit from their deeds except for fatigue and difficulty. Everyone is obligated to view their deeds through the lens of religion and weigh them with the correct scale, because Allah only accepts deeds that arise from a heart full of faith and sincerity (*ikhlas*).
text.15: In these verses, Allah swears by the stars that move and set. These stars are all invisible to sight during the day, but they will appear shining at night. Allah swears by these stars because in their alternating states, invisible during the day and shining at night, they are a sign of Allah's power that governs their movement.
text.16: In these verses, Allah swears by the stars that move and set. These stars are all invisible to sight during the day, but they appear shining at night. Allah swears by these stars because their alternating state, being invisible during the day and shining at night, is a sign of Allah's power that governs their movement.
text.17: In this verse, Allah swears by the night when it is about to depart from its darkness.
text.18:
Then, in this verse, Allah swears by the dawn when the daybreak begins to emerge and shine. The time of dawn is used by Allah in swearing because this time brings joyful hope to every human being who wakes up in the morning because they are facing a new day. At that time, they can find their needs for life, replace what was lost, and prepare for what is to come.

Then Allah explains what is made the object of His oath, with His words in the following verse.
text.19:
In these verses, Allah explains the object of the oath mentioned in verses 15-18 above, which is that what Muhammad saw. informed about the events of the Day of Judgment are not the words of a soothsayer or mere fabrications. Rather, it is truly a revelation brought by the Angel Gabriel from his Lord. Allah has described the messenger who carries the Qur'an, namely the Angel Gabriel, with five kinds of attributes that contain virtue:

1.  Noble in the sight of his Lord because Allah gives him something most valuable, namely guidance, and commands him to convey that guidance to His prophets to be passed on to His servants.

2.  Having the strength to preserve the Qur'an far from forgetfulness or error.

3.  Having a high position in the sight of Allah, the Owner of the 'Arash (Throne).

4.  Obeyed among the angels because of his authority.

5.  Trusted to convey revelation because he is protected from the characteristics of treachery and deviation.
text.20:
In these verses, Allah explains the object of the oath mentioned in verses 15-18 above, which is that what Muhammad saw (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) conveyed about the events of the Day of Judgment is not the words of a soothsayer or mere fabrication. Rather, it is truly a revelation brought by the Angel Gabriel from his Lord. Allah has described the messenger who carries the Qur'an, namely the Angel Gabriel, with five kinds of attributes that contain virtue:

1.  Noble in the sight of his Lord because Allah gives him something most precious, namely guidance, and commands him to convey that guidance to His prophets, to be passed on to His servants.

2.  Possessing strength in preserving the Qur'an far from forgetfulness or error.

3.  Having a high position in the sight of Allah, the Owner of the 'Arash (Throne).

4.  Obeyed among the angels because of his authority.

5.  Trusted to convey revelation because he is protected from the attributes of treachery and deviation.

Rather, it is truly revelation brought by the Angel Gabriel from his Lord. 4.  Obeyed among the angels because of his authority.

5.  Trusted to convey revelation because he is protected from the attributes of treachery and deviation.
text.22:
In this verse, Allah describes the Prophet Muhammad by stating that Muhammad is not insane, as accused by the disbelievers of Mecca.

The phrase "your companion" in this verse serves as a reason to explain their falsehood. This is because everyone will know the nature of their friend with whom they associate daily. The Quraysh people always associated with the Prophet Muhammad since he was a child and knew his honesty. Therefore, they gave him the honorary title of "al-Amin" before he became a prophet.

He never lied, broke promises, or betrayed trust, so whatever accusations were made against the Prophet Muhammad about being insane, a sorcerer, or a liar are purely false.
text.23:
The Prophet Muhammad once saw Gabriel in his original form twice in his life. First, when he was in the Cave of Hira before the revelation of Surah al-Muddatstsir, and second, when he ascended (mi'raj) to the seventh heaven. Allah says:

And he certainly saw him in another descent, At the Lote-tree of the utmost boundary - (an-Najm/53: 13-14)
text.24: This verse explains that the Prophet Muhammad was not stingy in conveying all the revelations that the angel Gabriel delivered to him. In addition to that, he was a very trustworthy person because he never changed the revelation, not even a single letter, with his own words.
text.25: In this verse, Allah explains that the Qur'an is not the word of a cursed devil, and it is not a word placed by the devil on Muhammad's tongue while disturbing his mind, as accused by the Quraysh. Muhammad was known from his childhood for his sound mind and never committed treachery. Therefore, what Muhammad explained about the news of the Hereafter, Paradise, and Hell is not the word of a devil.
text.26: Then Allah explains that the Quraysh people had gone astray, far from the path of truth, and did not know the path of wisdom, so Allah asks them, "Then where are you going?" The meaning is that after it has been explained that the Qur'an truly comes from Allah and within it are lessons and guidance that lead mankind to the straight path, the disbelievers are asked, "Which path will you take then?"
text.27: Then Allah states that the Qur'an is nothing but a reminder for all the worlds, for those who have hearts inclined towards goodness. However, not all people can benefit from this Qur'an. Those who benefit are those who want to take the straight path. As for those who deviate from that path, they cannot benefit from the reminder of the Qur'an.
text.28: Then Allah states that the Qur'an is nothing but a reminder for all of creation, for those who have hearts inclined towards goodness. However, not all people can benefit from this Qur'an. Those who benefit are those who want to take the straight path. As for those who deviate from that path, they cannot benefit from the reminder of the Qur'an.
text.29: In this verse, Allah states that humans do not have their own will to do something they desire if it is not in accordance with the will of Allah.
